newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: ASIAN CRUDE - LIGHT GRADES ACTIVELY TRADED UP.
newsitem.headline: ASIAN CRUDE - LIGHT GRADES ACTIVELY TRADED UP.

text.p: Asia's light crudes traded at higher levels, as refiners actively looked to cover their September requirements, traders said on Thursday.
September Belida was sold by a shosha to a European major at ICP +40 cents per barrel.
This is higher than a Belida trade done by another shosha earlier this week at ICP +30 and the +20 cents trades seen in early August.
September trading for Indonesian crudes normally start only when the monthly allocations are announced in the middle of August.
But limited availabilities of other light crudes have prompted buyers to emerge earlier this time, to prevent being caught short.
The firmness in Belida prices led Malaysia to move up its offer price of September Tapis, to APPI +20/25 cents from an earlier offer of APPI +15.
Trading on Australian crudes was thin, although a producer confirmed selling another September Cossack cargo at Tapis APPI -57 cents.
The seller had acquired this cargo from a shosha last week at Tapis APPI -80. The last Cossack trade was by the same seller to China at Tapis APPI -60.

A late September North West Shelf (NWS) condensate was also confirmed bought by a European trader who was heard to have accumulated a large volume of NWS condensate to take to its refinery in Australia.
The direction of the heavy crude market was less clear, with premiums discussed at varying levels.
August Minas was rumoured sold by a shosha at ICP +15 cents, the lowest levels seen since July.
At least one shosha is still looking to sell August Minas, although the volume was small, around 100,000 barrels.
But an equity producer sold August Duri on Wednesday at ICP +80, was offering September Minas at ICP +60.
Minas was trading around 40 cents per barrel under Duri in July and early August.
The Middle East crude market remained lacklustre.
Rumours that a European major had sold a September Masila to a South Korean refiner at OSP -45 cents was denied by the refiner.
